results.title: Dustbins in the sky
results.creator_credit: Mike Lockey, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Made for the television program “Perspective”, this documentary examined the growth of technology in the collection, transmission and dissemination of news, from early cinema newsreels to today’s satellite coverage.

results.title: Dust to dust
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a small town in northern NSW and the effects of asbestos mining there. The people estimate that three-quarters of the workers have died or are sick from exposure to asbestos. In presenting their story the film raises issues regarding occupational health in general.

results.title: Durer and the renaissance
results.brief_description: Part of the Art History series, describes the life and work of Albrecht Durer, German painter and engraver, and his part in connecting the artistic development in Italy with that of northern Europe.

results.title: Duplicating and manuscript
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Demonstrates the correct methods of making masters for duplicating machine use, correcting mistakes on a stencil, the use of the illuminated drawing board for tracing lines, making hectograph masters, correcting mistakes when using hectograph ribbon, or carbon, use of electromatic hectograph machine, use of various types of duplicating machines, and typing manuscripts with footnotes. Centering on a typewriter improving characters or marks that do not appear on the keyboard, and reading proof readers’ marks are also explained.

Centering on a typewriter improving characters or marks that do not appear on the keyboard, and reading proof readers’ marks are also explained.

results.title: Duplex
results.creator_credit: Michaela French, David Price and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Two elderly neighbours Elsie (Esme Melville) and Dora (Margaret Ricketts) are isolated by the limitations that their old age brings. Both are lonely but fail to strike up a friendship as personal obstacles like pride get in the way. Slowly, slowly, Elsie’s determination breaks Dora’s stubborn resistance and the two begin anew as friends. Written, directed and edited by Michaela French.

results.title: Dumbo: a lesson in being prepared
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Youngsters learn the pitfalls of trying things before they are prepared in this episode from Dumbo. Timothy Mouse pricks Dumbo with a pin to make him perform, despite the fact that Dumbo feels uncertain about his act. The result is a crashing failure that literally brings down the house. A charmingly anarchic affray, rendered with all the wide-eyed wonder of the Disney studio halcyon era.

results.title: Dumbo. Father Noah's ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.
results.brief_description: One of Disney’s most endearing animated films. Dumbo is the story of a baby circus animal born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all the other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse. After Dumbo is involved in several disastrous performances under the big top, Timothy decides to launch Dumbo as a new star - the world’s only flying elephant. Also included in this program are three Disney cartoons: “Father Noah’s ark”, “The Practical pig”, and “Three orphan kittens”.
results.title_for_label: Dumbo. Father Noah’s ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.

results.title: Dudu and the line
results.creator_credit: Steve French and Second Banana Films
results.brief_description: Explores the magic and fun of animation through Dudu, an ordinary little chap who encounters an extraordinary line which obeys nothing but the animator’s imagination. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Duane Hanson
results.brief_description: American sculptor Duane Hanson is a major figure in the neo-realist movement. He casts real people in plastic moulds and uses the painted cast, dressed and lifelike figures to make social and political comments which can be disturbing.
